workflow.name: WhatsApp support bot with Google Drive RAG, GPT-4.1-mini and Cohere reranking
workflow.description:
# WhatsApp RAG Agent (Text + Voice) with Weekly Google Drive Sync

**One-line summary :** Answers WhatsApp in under 100 words, understands voice notes, and retrieves trusted answers from your Google Drive docs (RAG) kept fresh weekly.

---

## What this template does

* **Reply to WhatsApp messages** in a polite, human tone with **‚â§100 words**.
* **Understands text and voice notes**: auto-downloads audio and transcribes to text.
* **Retrieves answers from your knowledge base (RAG)**: Google Drive docs ‚Üí chunk ‚Üí embed ‚Üí store in Supabase ‚Üí rerank with Cohere.
* **Keeps short-term memory** across the conversation to avoid repetition.
* **Weekly doc sync** from a selected Google Drive folder so non-technical staff can update content without touching n8n.

---

## Why it matters

* **Zero busywork:** Update a Google Doc; the bot learns it on the next sync.
* **Trustworthy answers:** Responses come from **your** vetted docs, not random web text.
* **Voice-first friendly:** Handles the WhatsApp reality of ‚Äúsend a voice note.‚Äù
* **Safer by design:** Guardrails‚Äîno pricing unless in KB, no pushy sales, no medical advice.

---

## Triggers

* **WhatsApp Trigger:** Receives incoming messages (text or audio).
* **Google Drive Trigger (weekly):** Detects new/updated files in the chosen folder for ingestion.

---

## App credentials required

* **WhatsApp Business Cloud** (App ID, Token, Phone Number ID)
* **OpenAI** (Chat + Embeddings)
* **Cohere** (Rerank)
* **Supabase** (SUPABASE_URL, ANON_KEY)
* **Google Drive** (OAuth2) + target Folder ID

---

## Suggested environment variables

```bash
WHATSAPP_APP_ID=
WHATSAPP_TOKEN=
WHATSAPP_PHONE_NUMBER_ID=
OPENAI_API_KEY=
COHERE_API_KEY=
SUPABASE_URL=
SUPABASE_ANON_KEY=
GDRIVE_FOLDER_ID=
RAG_TABLE_NAME="documents"     # table to store vectors/metadata
MAX_ANSWER_WORDS=100            # guardrail for concise replies
```

---

## Architecture overview

* **Answer-time lane (RAG Tool):**

  1. Receive WhatsApp message ‚Üí 2) Transcribe audio if present ‚Üí 3) Maintain short-term memory ‚Üí 4) Retrieve from Supabase vectors (topK) ‚Üí 5) Rerank with Cohere ‚Üí 6) Compose ‚â§100-word reply with sources ‚Üí 7) Send on WhatsApp.
* **Ingest lane (Weekly Sync):**
  A) Detect Drive file updates ‚Üí B) Download & convert (Docs ‚Üí text/plain) ‚Üí C) Chunk (size/overlap) ‚Üí D) Embed with OpenAI ‚Üí E) Upsert to Supabase with metadata & hashes.

---

## How it works (node rundown)

| #  | Node                                        | Key Inputs                      | Key Outputs                       |
| -- | ------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------- | --------------------------------- |
| 1  | **WhatsApp Trigger**                        | Incoming message                | Raw WhatsApp payload              |
| 2  | **Switch** (Attachment presence/type)       | Payload                         | Route: **Text** or **Audio**      |
| 3  | **HTTP Request** (Audio path)               | `attachments[0].data_url`       | Audio file                        |
| 4  | **OpenAI ‚Äì Translate/ASR**                  | Audio file                      | Transcribed text                  |
| 5  | **Merge**                                   | Text path + Audio path          | Unified text message              |
| 6  | **Simple Memory**                           | Recent turns                    | Short-term context                |
| 7  | **OpenAI Chat Model**                       | Prompt + message + memory       | Draft answer (tool calls allowed) |
| 8  | **Supabase Vector Tool (retrieve-as-tool)** | Query text, `topK=10`           | Candidate KB passages             |
| 9  | **Cohere Reranker**                         | Candidates                      | Re-ranked context                 |
| 10 | **Send WhatsApp Message**                   | `to`, `body`                    | Reply sent                        |
| 11 | **Google Drive Trigger (weekly)**           | Folder ID, `fileUpdated`        | Changed files                     |
| 12 | **Set (File Id)**                           | id from trigger                 | File ref                          |
| 13 | **Google Drive ‚Äì Download File**            | Id (Docs‚Üítxt)                   | Raw text                          |
| 14 | **Character Text Splitter**                 | `chunkSize=2000`, `overlap=300` | Chunks                            |
| 15 | **Default Data Loader**                     | Binary‚ÜíDocument                 | Clean docs                        |
| 16 | **OpenAI Embeddings (ingest)**              | Chunks                          | Vectors                           |
| 17 | **Supabase Vector Store (insert)**          | Table: `documents`              | Upserted KB                       |

**Notes**

* The **KB Tool** is the combo of steps 8‚Äì9‚Äì7 at answer time (retrieve ‚Üí rerank ‚Üí answer).
* The **Ingest lane** is steps 11‚Äì17 (weekly sync of your Drive folder).

---

## Setup (7‚Äëminute sprint)

1. **Import the workflow** JSON.
2. **Connect credentials:** WhatsApp, OpenAI, Cohere, Supabase, Google Drive.
3. **Google Drive Trigger:** paste your **Folder ID**; keep `fileUpdated` event.
4. **Download File:** ensure Google Docs convert to **text/plain**.
5. **Supabase Vector Store (insert):** set table name to **`documents`** (or your schema).
6. **Character Text Splitter:** keep `chunkSize=2000`, `overlap=300` (balanced recall/latency).
7. **Retrieve-as-tool:** set `topK=10` and **enable reranker**.
8. **Send WhatsApp Message** mapping:

   * **Recipient**: `{{$("WhatsApp Trigger").item.json.messages[0].from}}`
   * **Body**: `{{$json.output}}`
9. **Test:**

   * Send a **text** and a **voice note** to your WhatsApp number ‚Üí confirm concise answers.
   * Drop a Google Doc into the watched folder ‚Üí verify it‚Äôs chunked/embedded on the next weekly poll (or run ingest nodes once manually).

---

## Prompt, tone & guardrails

* **System prompt:**

  * Be polite, human, and concise (**‚â§ `MAX_ANSWER_WORDS`**).
  * Cite or reference **only** the KB content; if unknown, say so and offer to escalate.
  * **No prices** unless present in the KB. **No medical advice.**
* **Temperature:** start at **0.2** for factual replies.
* **Memory window:** keep a short rolling buffer (e.g., last 4‚Äì6 turns).

---

## Data model (minimum viable)

Table **`documents`** (example columns):

* `id` (uuid)
* `source_url` (text)
* `title` (text)
* `chunk` (text)
* `embedding` (vector/float[] depending on extension)
* `chunk_hash` (text)
* `updated_at` (timestamp)

**Indexes**

* Unique index on `chunk_hash` to dedupe
* Index on `updated_at` for syncs

---

## Observability & ops

* Log **question**, **selected chunk ids/hashes**, and **final response** to a DB/Sheet for QA.
* Add a **low-confidence** route (score threshold) ‚Üí Slack/Telegram escalation to a human.
* Track **latency** and **token usage** to tune `topK` and chunk sizes.

---

## Customization

* **Latency vs quality:** try `topK=6‚Äì8` and `chunkSize=1200` for speed.
* **Languages:** ASR node can be swapped for native multilingual output.
* **Escalation:** add channel handoff on low confidence or no KB hits.
* **Sync cadence:** change Drive Trigger to **daily** if content updates frequently.

---

## Safety & compliance

* **No medical advice.** If uncertain or clinical, ask to schedule a consult or refer to the right department.
* **PII:** Don‚Äôt log full phone numbers in plaintext analytics; hash where possible.
* **Prices & rates:** Only answer if present in the KB; otherwise hand off to front desk.

---

## Troubleshooting

* **No reply sent:** Ensure **Send message** node reads `{{$json.output}}` (Agent‚Äôs response property).
* **Audio path failing:** Confirm `attachments[0].data_url` exists and HTTP node fetches a valid file.
* **KB not updating:** Manually execute the ingest lane; check rows in Supabase.
* **Irrelevant answers:** Lower temperature to **0.2**, increase overlap to **400**, and verify Drive docs are clean and structured.

---

## Categories & tags

* **Categories:** AI, Customer Support, Healthcare Ops, RAG, WhatsApp
* **Tags:** WhatsApp, RAG, Google Drive, Supabase, OpenAI, Cohere, Voice Notes

---

## Pricing (rough, BYO keys)

* **n8n:** self-host free; n8n.cloud billed by plan.
* **OpenAI, Cohere:** usage-based by tokens/calls.
* **Supabase:** free tier + usage; vector storage billed by size.
* **WhatsApp Cloud:** Meta pricing per conversation.

---

## Nodes used in workflow

**WhatsApp Trigger**, **Switch**, **HTTP Request**, **OpenAI (ASR + Chat + Embeddings)**, **Merge**, **Simple Memory**, **Supabase Vector Tool (retrieve)**, **Cohere Reranker**, **Google Drive Trigger**, **Set**, **Google Drive ‚Äì Download**, **Character Text Splitter**, **Default Data Loader**.

options.systemMessage:
=SYSTEM ROLE
You are intelligent and the best customer support agent for **HolistiCare (DHA, Lahore)**.
Tone: concise, friendly, courteous, professional. No emojis. Spartan wording.Be sympathetic and empathetic with the customer. 

CONTEXT 

HolistiCare is a multi-specialty clinic in DHA Phase 3, Lahore, providing care across: Dermatology/Aesthetics, Dentistry, Physiotherapy (incl. Hijama), Psychology & Psychiatry, Nutrition/Weight Loss, Pediatrics, Orthopedics, Gastroenterology, Urology, Neurology, Eye/Optometry, Internal Medicine/Diabetology/Endocrinology/Pulmonology, Gynecology, and Lab Testing.
- The customer are frustrated and want good treatment always treat them in a way they feel appriciated 
- only converse with the user and provide them with information in a friendly  manner 
- Ask the problems in a polite  way and address them with a solution 


tool: 'Knowledge_base'
description: use this tool to address user symtopms and their queries regarding the clinic and their symptoms. make sure the output is not more than a single paragraph 

Behaviour
- Always try to sound like a human have two way communication with the user
- Do not bombard them information guide them towards their needs and then provide them with a solution  
- do not draft an appointment message only address the customer query in a loving manner 
- Do not push the user to make an appointment  
- Only make an appointment when asked for 
- do not mention booking appointment if not asked 


GUARDRAILS
- keep the replies under 100 words always 
- Keep replies short and non-repetitive.
- Do **not** quote prices unless explicitly provided by the clinic in the 'Knowlege_base' tool
- Do **not** provide medical advice; recommend a consult when needed.If not in the 'Knowledge_base'
- If user insists on an unavailable service/doctor ‚Üí suggest nearest department or route to front desk.
- Prefer WhatsApp/phone handoff upon any ambiguity the agent cannot resolve quickly.

parameters.toolDescription: Use this tool to address customer queries regarding their symptoms and their queries regarding the clinic.

parameters.content:
#  WhatsApp ‚Üí AI Agent (OpenAI + Supabase KB) ‚Üí Reply

This workflow turns incoming **WhatsApp** messages (text or audio) into **short, friendly clinic replies** using an AI Agent with memory and a Supabase-powered knowledge base. It enforces guardrails (‚â§100 words, no pricing unless in KB, no hard sells).

---

## 0) What you need ready

* **n8n**: running with a public URL.
* **Meta WhatsApp Business**:

  * A phone number connected to the app.
  * **Webhook verified** to your n8n WhatsApp Trigger node (Production URL).
* **Credentials** configured in n8n:

  * **WhatsApp Trigger** (App ID, Secret, Verify Token).
  * **WhatsApp Send** (Phone Number ID + Access Token) for `Send message` node.
  * **OpenAI** (for Chat + Transcription) ‚Üí used by `OpenAI Chat Model` and `Translate a recording`.
  * **Supabase** (URL + Key) ‚Üí used by `Kknowledge_base` (vector store).
  * **Cohere** (optional but wired) for reranking.
* **Supabase Table**: `documents` populated with clinic FAQs/policies/services (chunked & embedded). Keep it accurate‚Äî**agent won‚Äôt invent prices or services**.

---

## 1) How the flow runs (high level)

1. **Inbound** ‚Üí `WhatsApp Trigger` receives a user message.
2. **Branch** ‚Üí `Switch` checks `messages[0].type`:

   * `text` ‚Üí goes straight to `Merge` ‚Üí `Edit Fields1`.
   * `audio` ‚Üí fetch media (`HTTP Request` ‚Üí `HTTP Request1`) ‚Üí `Translate a recording` (speech‚Üítext) ‚Üí into `Merge`.
3. **Normalize fields** ‚Üí `Edit Fields1` sets:

   * `Phone` = sender phone
   * `text` = unified message text (either the typed text or transcription)
4. **Agent runtime**:

   * `OpenAI Chat Model` (gpt-4.1-mini, temp 0.3) provides reasoning/response engine.
   * **Memory** ‚Üí `Simple Memory` uses `Phone` to keep short conversational context per user.
   * **Knowledge Tool** ‚Üí `Kknowledge_base` (Supabase vector search, topK=10, with Cohere reranker) is available to the agent **as a tool** for grounding answers.
   * **Agent** ‚Üí `AI Agent` applies the clinic-specific system prompt and guardrails to produce **‚â§100 words** replies.
5. **Deliver** ‚Üí `Send message` replies on WhatsApp with `{{$json.output}}`.

---

## 2) One-time setup checks

* **WhatsApp Trigger**: subscribe to `messages` updates; set Verify Token; use the **Production** webhook URL in Meta.
* **Switch** node**: rules check exactly `text` or `audio` on `messages[0].type`.
* **Audio path**:

  * `HTTP Request` GET media metadata from Graph API using `messages[0].audio.id` + `access_token` query.
  * `HTTP Request1` downloads the file using returned `url` and `Authorization: Bearer <PAGE_ACCESS_TOKEN>` header.
  * `Translate a recording` uses your **OpenAI** credential (Whisper/translate) to output text.
* **Edit Fields1**: confirm the expressions:

  ```
  Phone   = {{$('WhatsApp Trigger').item.json.messages[0].from}}
  text    = {{$json.text}}{{$json.messages[0].text.body}}
  ```

  This concatenates either transcription (`$json.text`) or typed text.
* **Agent**:

  * `OpenAI Chat Model`: model `gpt-4.1-mini`, temperature `0.3`.
  * `AI Agent` system message includes tone/guardrails for **HolistiCare (DHA, Lahore)**.
  * **Connect** Memory (`Simple Memory` with `sessionKey = {{$json.Phone}}`) and Tool (`Kknowledge_base`) to the Agent.
* **Supabase KB** (`Kknowledge_base`): mode `retrieve-as-tool`, table `documents`, `topK=10`, `useReranker=true`. Ensure embeddings in your table align with the model you indexed with.
* **Reranker Cohere** (optional): wired into the KB for better results; needs valid key.
* **Send message**: Set `phoneNumberId` and credential to your WhatsApp Business account; recipient is `{{$('WhatsApp Trigger').item.json.messages[0].from}}`.

---

## 3) Guardrails the agent follows (baked in)

* ‚â§100 words, concise, human, empathetic, no emojis.
* No prices unless present in **Knowledge_base**.
* No medical advice; suggest consult when needed.
* Don‚Äôt push bookings; only book if asked.
* Prefer quick handoff to WhatsApp/phone if unclear.

---

## 4) How to test end‚Äëto‚Äëend (fast)

1. In Meta, send a **text** WhatsApp message to your business number.
2. Check n8n exec: should follow **text path** ‚Üí Agent ‚Üí reply ‚â§100 words.
3. Send an **audio** note: verify **audio path** ‚Üí download ‚Üí transcribe ‚Üí Agent ‚Üí reply.
4. Ask for **price** not in KB: agent should **avoid quoting** and suggest contacting front desk.
5. Ask for a **service** not offered: agent should route to nearest department or front desk.

---

## 5) Customization quick wins

* **Tone**: adjust in the Agent system message (keep length & guardrails).
* **Word limit**: change the guardrail in the system message and test.
* **Memory window**: configure `Simple Memory` buffer length for more/less context.
* **Stronger grounding**: lower `topK` or tighten KB content; consider domain tags in your Supabase documents.
* **Switch language**: rely on OpenAI translate path for audio; for text, add language detection pre‚Äëstep if needed.

---

## 6) Troubleshooting

* **No trigger**: ensure Meta webhook points to the **Production** URL of `WhatsApp Trigger` and events are subscribed.
* **Audio fails to download**: check Graph `access_token` and that `HTTP Request1` sends `Authorization: Bearer <PAGE_ACCESS_TOKEN>`.
* **Transcription empty**: confirm `Translate a recording` credential and response mapping into `Merge`.
* **Agent ignores KB**: verify `Kknowledge_base` is connected as a **tool** to `AI Agent` and your Supabase table has data.
* **Long replies**: tighten the system prompt; reduce temperature; add ‚Äústrictly under 100 words‚Äù at the end.
* **No outgoing message**: check `Send message` phoneNumberId, token, and WhatsApp Business permissions.

---

## 7) Mental model

WhatsApp in ‚Üí (text OR audio‚Üítext) ‚Üí normalize ‚Üí Agent (OpenAI) + Memory + KB tool ‚Üí short, safe reply ‚Üí WhatsApp out. Keep the KB clean and the agent stays honest. ‚úÖ

# : Auto‚Äëingest Google Drive docs into a Supabase Vector Store (for your KB)

This workflow watches a Google Drive **folder** and, when a file is updated, it **downloads ‚Üí chunks ‚Üí embeds ‚Üí inserts** the text into a Supabase **`documents`** table for retrieval‚Äëaugmented agents.

---

## 0) What you need ready

* **n8n** publicly reachable.
* **Google Drive** OAuth credential with access to the watched folder.
* **Supabase** project with a `documents` table that your vector store node is configured to use.
* **OpenAI** API key (for embeddings).

---

## 1) How it runs (bird‚Äôs‚Äëeye)

1. **Trigger** ‚Üí `Google Drive Trigger` polls **weekly (Sunday)** for `fileUpdated` events in the specified folder.
2. **Capture file id** ‚Üí `Edit Fields` sets `id = {{$json.id}}` for clean passing.
3. **Download** ‚Üí `Download file` pulls the file by id. If it‚Äôs a Google Doc/Sheet/Slide, it **converts Docs to `text/plain`** per options.
4. **(Optional) Chunking** ‚Üí `Character Text Splitter` defines chunk strategy (size **2000**, overlap **300**) and feeds `Default Data Loader`.
5. **Embed + Insert** ‚Üí

   * `Embeddings OpenAI` provides the embedding model to the vector pipeline.
   * `Default Data Loader` hands doc parts to the **`Supabase Vector Store`** (mode **insert**) which writes rows into **`documents`**.

> Result: your updated Drive file is indexed for semantic search in Supabase.

---

## 2) One‚Äëtime setup checks

* **Google Drive Trigger**

  * `Trigger on`: **Specific folder** ‚Üí confirm the folder id is correct.
  * `Event`: **fileUpdated** (fires when a file changes in that folder or its children).
  * `Poll schedule`: weekly; adjust if you want faster ingestion.
* **Download file**

  * `operation`: download by file id.
  * **Google Docs conversion**: set to `docsToFormat: text/plain` (already set). Non‚ÄëDocs (PDF, .txt, .md) are downloaded as is.
* **Character Text Splitter**

  * `separator`: `.`
  * `chunkSize`: **2000** | `chunkOverlap`: **300** (safe defaults; tune for your model).
* **Embeddings OpenAI**

  * Make sure the credential points to the right key; pick a modern embedding model (e.g., `text-embedding-3-small` or your preferred).
* **Supabase Vector Store**

  * `mode`: **insert**
  * `tableName`: **documents**
  * Has Supabase URL + service key in credentials.
  * `options.queryName`: **match_documents** (the RPC you‚Äôll use at query time).

---

## 3) Supported files & tips

* **Google Docs** ‚Üí auto‚Äëconverted to plain text.
* **Plain text/Markdown** ‚Üí ingests directly.
* **PDF/Images** ‚Üí not OCR‚Äôd by default. Add an OCR/parse step if needed before chunking.
* Keep content clean: remove boilerplate headers/footers in source to avoid noisy chunks.

---

## 4) Customization quick wins

* **Faster indexing**: change the trigger to `everyHour` or `every15Minutes`.
* **Selective ingest**: filter by mimeType or filename in the trigger, or add a `Switch` node.
* **Metadata**: add a `Set` node to attach `source`, `path`, `version`, `updatedAt` and map these to Supabase columns.
* **De‚Äëduplication**: before insert, call a Supabase function to upsert by `(source, doc_id, chunk_id)`.
* **Chunking**: for Q&A docs, smaller chunks (e.g., 800/120 overlap) may give tighter hits.
* **Embeddings model**: stay consistent between **index** and **query** pipelines to avoid vector mismatch.

---

## 5) Troubleshooting (fast)

* **No events**: the file wasn‚Äôt actually ‚Äúupdated,‚Äù or polling window too wide; shorten schedule or manually bump file versions.
* **Blank text**: conversion failed or binary file not supported; add a converter/OCR step.
* **Insert errors**: check Supabase row size/column mapping; ensure your table schema matches what the node sends.
* **Bad retrieval**: adjust chunking, ensure the same embedding model is used at query time, and verify you‚Äôre calling `match_documents` with sensible `topK`.

---

## 6) Mental model

Drive update ‚Üí Download (+convert) ‚Üí Split ‚Üí Embed ‚Üí Insert into Supabase. Once this is solid, your chatbot/agent can query `match_documents` and stay fresh without manual uploads. ‚úÖ
